messages.content: You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
How many times did I go runnign this week? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT COUNT(*)::int AS run_count FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'run') AND ua.activity_timestamp >= date_trunc('week', CURRENT_DATE - interval '1 day') + interval '1 day'"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
Show my swmiming sessions [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, a.name AS activity FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'swim') ORDER BY ua.activity_timestamp DESC"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
Whats my avarage pace for biking? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT AVG((distance_val / 1000.0) / (duration_val / 3600.0)) AS avg_speed_kmh FROM (SELECT ua.user_activity_id, MAX(CASE WHEN ad.activity_detail_type = 'duration' THEN uad.duration_in_sec END) AS duration_val, MAX(CASE WHEN ad.activity_detail_type = 'distance' THEN uad.distance_in_meters END) AS distance_val FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id JOIN activity_detail ad ON uad.activity_detail_id = ad.activity_detail_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'bike | cycling') GROUP BY ua.user_activity_id) sub WHERE duration_val > 0 AND distance_val > 0"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
How far did i wlak yesterday? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT SUM(uad.distance_in_meters) / 1000.0 AS total_km FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'walk') AND uad.activity_detail_type = 'distance' AND ua.activity_timestamp::date = CURRENT_DATE - interval '1 day'"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
Show me my yogo sessions [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, a.name AS activity FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'yoga') ORDER BY ua.activity_timestamp DESC"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
Whne was my last workoout? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, a.name AS activity FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_category ac ON a.activity_category_id = ac.activity_category_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ac.activity_category_code = 'workouts' ORDER BY ua.activity_timestamp DESC LIMIT 1"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
How long did i slepe last night? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT uad.duration_in_sec FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'sleep') AND ua.activity_timestamp::date = CURRENT_DATE - interval '1 day' AND uad.activity_detail_type = 'duration' LIMIT 1"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT SUM(uad.distance_in_meters) / 1000.0 AS total_km FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'cycle | cycling | bike') AND uad.activity_detail_type = 'distance'"}

Hwo many caloris did I burn? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT SUM(uad.numeric_value) AS total_calories FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity_detail ad ON ad.activity_id = ua.activity_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id AND uad.activity_detail_id = ad.activity_detail_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ad.label ILIKE '%calorie%'"}

Show acitivities from last wendsday [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, a.name AS activity FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ua.activity_timestamp::date = CURRENT_DATE - ((EXTRACT(dow FROM CURRENT_DATE)::int + 4) % 7 + 1)::int ORDER BY ua.activity_timestamp"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
What was my runing pace today? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT (duration_val / 60.0) / (distance_val / 1000.0) AS pace_min_per_km FROM (SELECT ua.user_activity_id, MAX(CASE WHEN ad.activity_detail_type = 'duration' THEN uad.duration_in_sec END) AS duration_val, MAX(CASE WHEN ad.activity_detail_type = 'distance' THEN uad.distance_in_meters END) AS distance_val FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id JOIN activity_detail ad ON uad.activity_detail_id = ad.activity_detail_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'run') AND ad.use_for_pace_calculation = true AND ua.activity_timestamp::date = CURRENT_DATE GROUP BY ua.user_activity_id) sub WHERE distance_val > 0"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, a.name AS activity, ua.activity_name_override AS trail_name FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'hike | hiking') ORDER BY ua.activity_timestamp DESC"}

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT MIN((duration_val / 60.0) / (distance_val / 1000.0)) AS fastest_pace_min_per_km FROM (SELECT ua.user_activity_id, MAX(CASE WHEN ad.activity_detail_type = 'duration' THEN uad.duration_in_sec END) AS duration_val, MAX(CASE WHEN ad.activity_detail_type = 'distance' THEN uad.distance_in_meters END) AS distance_val FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id JOIN activity_detail ad ON uad.activity_detail_id = ad.activity_detail_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'run') AND ad.use_for_pace_calculation = true GROUP BY ua.user_activity_id) sub WHERE distance_val > 0"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
